5403 * To change the list address, you need to program Register 4 (Transmit Descriptor List Address Register) with a new value when this bit is reset.
5404 * The new value is considered when this bit is set again.
5405 * The stop transmission command is effective only when the transmission of the current frame is complete or the transmission is in the Suspended state.
5406 */
5407#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_MASK (0x2000U)
5408#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_SHIFT (13U)
5409#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_MASK)
5410#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_ST_SHIFT)
5411
5412/*
5413 * RFD (RW)
5414 *
5415 * Threshold for Deactivating Flow Control (in half-duplex and full-duplex modes) These bits control the threshold (Fill-level of Rx FIFO) at which the flow control is de-asserted after activation.
5416 * - 00: Full minus 1 KB, that is, FULL — 1 KB
5417 * - 01: Full minus 2 KB, that is, FULL — 2 KB
5418 * - 10: Full minus 3 KB, that is, FULL — 3 KB
5419 * - 11: Full minus 4 KB, that is, FULL — 4 KB
5420 * The de-assertion is effective only after flow control is asserted.
5421 * If the Rx FIFO is 8 KB or more, an additional Bit (RFD_2) is used for more threshold levels as described in Bit 22.
5422 * These bits are reserved and read-only when the Rx FIFO depth is less than 4 KB.
5423 */
5424#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_MASK (0x1800U)
5425#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_SHIFT (11U)
5426#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_MASK)
5427#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFD_SHIFT)
5428
5429/*
5430 * RFA (RW)
5431 *
5432 * Threshold for Activating Flow Control (in half-duplex and full-duplex modes)
5433 * These bits control the threshold (Fill level of Rx FIFO) at which the flow control is activated.
5434 * - 00: Full minus 1 KB, that is, FULL—1KB.
5435 * - 01: Full minus 2 KB, that is, FULL—2KB.
5436 * - 10: Full minus 3 KB, that is, FULL—3KB.
5437 * - 11: Full minus 4 KB, that is, FULL—4KB.
5438 * These values are applicable only to Rx FIFOs of 4 KB or more and when Bit 8 (EFC) is set high. If the Rx FIFO is 8 KB or more,
5439 * an additional Bit (RFA_2) is used for more threshold levels as described in Bit 23.
5440 * These bits are reserved and read-only when the depth of Rx FIFO is less than 4 KB.
5441 * Note: When FIFO size is exactly 4 KB, although the DWC_gmac allows you to program the value of these bits to 11,
5442 * the software should not program these bits to 2'b11. The value 2'b11 means flow control on FIFO empty condition
5443 */
5444#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_MASK (0x600U)
5445#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_SHIFT (9U)
5446#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_MASK)
5447#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RFA_SHIFT)
5448
5449/*
5450 * EFC (RW)
5451 *
5452 * Enable HW Flow Control
5453 * When this bit is set, the flow control signal operation based on the fill-level of Rx FIFO is enabled.
5454 * When reset, the flow control operation is disabled.
5455 * This bit is not used (reserved and always reset) when the Rx FIFO is less than 4 KB.
5456 */
5457#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_MASK (0x100U)
5458#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_SHIFT (8U)
5459#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_MASK)
5460#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_EFC_SHIFT)
5461
5462/*
5463 * FEF (RW)
5464 *
5465 * Forward Error Frames
5466 * When this bit is reset, the Rx FIFO drops frames with error status (CRC error, collision error, GMII_ER, giant frame, watchdog timeout, or overflow).
5467 * However, if the start byte (write) pointer of a frame is already transferred to the read controller side (in Threshold mode),
5468 * then the frame is not dropped. In the GMAC-MTL configuration in which the Frame Length FIFO is also enabled during core configuration,
5469 * the Rx FIFO drops the error frames if that frame's start byte is not transferred (output) on the ARI bus.
5470 * When the FEF bit is set, all frames except runt error frames are forwarded to the DMA.
5471 * If the Bit 25 (RSF) is set and the Rx FIFO overflows when a partial frame is written,
5472 * then the frame is dropped irrespective of the FEF bit setting.
5473 * However, if the Bit 25 (RSF) is reset and the Rx FIFO overflows when a partial frame is written, then a partial frame may be forwarded to the DMA.
5474 * Note: When FEF bit is reset, the giant frames are dropped if the giant frame status is given in Rx Status (in Table 8-6 or Table 8-23) in the following configurations:
5475 * - The IP checksum engine (Type 1) and full checksum offload engine (Type 2) are not selected.
5476 * - The advanced timestamp feature is not selected but the extended status is selected.
5477 * The extended status is available with the following features:
5478 * - L3-L4 filter in GMAC-CORE or GMAC-MTL configurations
5479 * - Full checksum offload engine (Type 2) with enhanced descriptor format in the GMAC-DMA, GMAC-AHB, or GMAC-AXI configurations.
5480 */
5481#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_MASK (0x80U)
5482#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_SHIFT (7U)
5483#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_MASK)
5484#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FEF_SHIFT)
5485
5486/*
5487 * FUF (RW)
5488 *
5489 * Forward Undersized Good Frames
5490 * When set, the Rx FIFO forwards Undersized frames (that is, frames with no Error and length less than 64 bytes) including pad-bytes and CRC
5491 * When reset, the Rx FIFO drops all frames of less than 64 bytes, unless a frame is already transferred because of the lower value of Receive Threshold, for example, RTC = 01.
5492 */
5493#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_MASK (0x40U)
5494#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_SHIFT (6U)
5495#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_MASK)
5496#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_FUF_SHIFT)
5497
5498/*
5499 * DGF (RW)
5500 *
5501 * Drop Giant Frames
5502 * When set, the MAC drops the received giant frames in the Rx FIFO,
5503 * that is, frames that are larger than the computed giant frame limit.
5504 * When reset, the MAC does not drop the giant frames in the Rx FIFO.
5505 * Note: This bit is available in the following configurations in which the giant frame status is not provided in Rx status and giant frames are not dropped by default:
5506 * - Configurations in which IP Checksum Offload (Type 1) is selected in Rx
5507 * - Configurations in which the IPC Full Checksum Offload Engine (Type 2) is selected in Rx with normal descriptor format
5508 * - Configurations in which the Advanced Timestamp feature is selected In all other configurations, this bit is not used (reserved and always reset).
5509 */
5510#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_MASK (0x20U)
5511#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_SHIFT (5U)
5512#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_MASK)
5513#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_DGF_SHIFT)
5514
5515/*
5516 * RTC (RW)
5517 *
5518 * Receive Threshold Control
5519 * These two bits control the threshold level of the MTL Receive FIFO.
5520 * Transfer (request) to DMA starts when the frame size within the MTL Receive FIFO is larger than the threshold.
5521 * In addition, full frames with length less than the threshold are automatically transferred.
5522 * The value of 11 is not applicable if the configured Receive FIFO size is 128 bytes.
5523 * These bits are valid only when the RSF bit is zero, and are ignored when the RSF bit is set to 1.
5524 * - 00: 64
5525 * - 01: 32
5526 * - 10: 96
5527 * - 11: 128
5528 */
5529#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_MASK (0x18U)
5530#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_SHIFT (3U)
5531#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_MASK)
5532#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_RTC_SHIFT)
5533
5534/*
5535 * OSF (RW)
5536 *
5537 * Operate on Second Frame
5538 * When this bit is set, it instructs the DMA to process the second frame of the Transmit data even before the status for the first frame is obtained.
5539 */
5540#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_MASK (0x4U)
5541#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_SHIFT (2U)
5542#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_MASK)
5543#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_OSF_SHIFT)
5544
5545/*
5546 * SR (RW)
5547 *
5548 * Start or Stop Receive
5549 * When this bit is set, the Receive process is placed in the Running state.
5550 * The DMA attempts to acquire the descriptor from the Receive list and processes the incoming frames.
5551 * The descriptor acquisition is attempted from the current position in the list,
5552 * which is the address set by the Register 3 (Receive Descriptor List Address Register) or the position retained when the Receive process was previously stopped.
5553 * If the DMA does not own the descriptor, reception is suspended and Bit 7 (Receive Buffer Unavailable) of Register 5 (Status Register) is set.
5554 * The Start Receive command is effective only when the reception has stopped.
5555 * If the command is issued before setting Register 3 (Receive Descriptor List Address Register), the DMA behavior is unpredictable.
5556 * When this bit is cleared, the Rx DMA operation is stopped after the transfer of the current frame.
5557 * The next descriptor position in the Receive list is saved and becomes the current position after the Receive process is restarted.
5558 * The Stop Receive command is effective only when the Receive process is in either the Running (waiting for receive packet) or in the Suspended state.
5559 */
5560#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_MASK (0x2U)
5561#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_SHIFT (1U)
5562#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_MASK)
5563#define ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_OP_MODE_SR_SHIFT)
5564
5565/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_INTR_EN */
5566/*
5567 * NIE (RW)
5568 *
5569 * Normal Interrupt Summary Enable
5570 * When this bit is set, normal interrupt summary is enabled.
5571 * When this bit is reset, normal interrupt summary is disabled.
5572 * This bit enables the following interrupts in Register 5 (Status Register):
5573 * - Register 5[0]: Transmit Interrupt
5574 * - Register 5[2]: Transmit Buffer Unavailable
5575 * - Register 5[6]: Receive Interrupt
5576 * - Register 5[14]: Early Receive Interrupt
5577 */
5578#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_MASK (0x10000UL)
5579#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_SHIFT (16U)
5580#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_MASK)
5581#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_NIE_SHIFT)
5582
5583/*
5584 * AIE (RW)
5585 *
5586 * Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable
5587 * When this bit is set, abnormal interrupt summary is enabled.
5588 * When this bit is reset, the abnormal interrupt summary is disabled.
5589 * This bit enables the following interrupts in Register 5 (Status Register):
5590 * - Register 5[1]: Transmit Process Stopped
5591 * - Register 5[3]: Transmit Jabber Timeout
5592 * - Register 5[4]: Receive Overflow
5593 * - Register 5[5]: Transmit Underflow
5594 * - Register 5[7]: Receive Buffer Unavailable
5595 * - Register 5[8]: Receive Process Stopped
5596 * - Register 5[9]: Receive Watchdog Timeout
5597 * - Register 5[10]: Early Transmit Interrupt
5598 * - Register 5[13]: Fatal Bus Error
5599 */
5600#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_MASK (0x8000U)
5601#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_SHIFT (15U)
5602#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_MASK)
5603#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_AIE_SHIFT)
5604
5605/*
5606 * ERE (RW)
5607 *
5608 * Early Receive Interrupt Enable
5609 * When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 16), the Early Receive Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Early Receive Interrupt is disabled.
5610 */
5611#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_MASK (0x4000U)
5612#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_SHIFT (14U)
5613#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_MASK)
5614#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ERE_SHIFT)
5615
5616/*
5617 * FBE (RW)
5618 *
5619 * Fatal Bus Error Enable
5620 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Fatal Bus Error Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Fatal Bus Error Enable Interrupt is disabled.
5621 */
5622#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_MASK (0x2000U)
5623#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_SHIFT (13U)
5624#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_MASK)
5625#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_FBE_SHIFT)
5626
5627/*
5628 * ETE (RW)
5629 *
5630 * Early Transmit Interrupt Enable
5631 * When this bit is set with an Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Early Transmit Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Early Transmit Interrupt is disabled.
5632 */
5633#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_MASK (0x400U)
5634#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_SHIFT (10U)
5635#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_MASK)
5636#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_ETE_SHIFT)
5637
5638/*
5639 * RWE (RW)
5640 *
5641 * Receive Watchdog Timeout Enable
5642 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Receive Watchdog Timeout Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Receive Watchdog Timeout Interrupt is disabled.
5643 */
5644#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_MASK (0x200U)
5645#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_SHIFT (9U)
5646#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_MASK)
5647#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RWE_SHIFT)
5648
5649/*
5650 * RSE (RW)
5651 *
5652 * Receive Stopped Enable
5653 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Receive Stopped Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Receive Stopped Interrupt is disabled.
5654 */
5655#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_MASK (0x100U)
5656#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_SHIFT (8U)
5657#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_MASK)
5658#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RSE_SHIFT)
5659
5660/*
5661 * RUE (RW)
5662 *
5663 * Receive Buffer Unavailable Enable
5664 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Receive Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Receive Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is disabled.
5665 */
5666#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_MASK (0x80U)
5667#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_SHIFT (7U)
5668#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_MASK)
5669#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RUE_SHIFT)
5670
5671/*
5672 * RIE (RW)
5673 *
5674 * Receive Interrupt Enable
5675 * When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 16), the Receive Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Receive Interrupt is disabled.
5676 */
5677#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_MASK (0x40U)
5678#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_SHIFT (6U)
5679#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_MASK)
5680#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_RIE_SHIFT)
5681
5682/*
5683 * UNE (RW)
5684 *
5685 * Underflow Interrupt Enable
5686 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Transmit Underflow Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Underflow Interrupt is disabled.
5687 */
5688#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_MASK (0x20U)
5689#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_SHIFT (5U)
5690#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_MASK)
5691#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_UNE_SHIFT)
5692
5693/*
5694 * OVE (RW)
5695 *
5696 * Overflow Interrupt Enable
5697 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Receive Overflow Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Overflow Interrupt is disabled.
5698 */
5699#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_MASK (0x10U)
5700#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_SHIFT (4U)
5701#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_MASK)
5702#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_OVE_SHIFT)
5703
5704/*
5705 * TJE (RW)
5706 *
5707 * Transmit Jabber Timeout Enable
5708 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Transmit Jabber Timeout Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Transmit Jabber Timeout Interrupt is disabled.
5709 */
5710#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_MASK (0x8U)
5711#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_SHIFT (3U)
5712#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_MASK)
5713#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TJE_SHIFT)
5714
5715/*
5716 * TUE (RW)
5717 *
5718 * Transmit Buffer Unavailable Enable
5719 * When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 16), the Transmit Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Transmit Buffer Unavailable Interrupt is disabled.
5720 */
5721#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_MASK (0x4U)
5722#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_SHIFT (2U)
5723#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_MASK)
5724#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TUE_SHIFT)
5725
5726/*
5727 * TSE (RW)
5728 *
5729 * Transmit Stopped Enable
5730 * When this bit is set with Abnormal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 15), the Transmission Stopped Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Transmission Stopped Interrupt is disabled.
5731 */
5732#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_MASK (0x2U)
5733#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_SHIFT (1U)
5734#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_MASK)
5735#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TSE_SHIFT)
5736
5737/*
5738 * TIE (RW)
5739 *
5740 * Transmit Interrupt Enable
5741 * When this bit is set with Normal Interrupt Summary Enable (Bit 16), the Transmit Interrupt is enabled. When this bit is reset, the Transmit Interrupt is disabled.
5742 */
5743#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_MASK (0x1U)
5744#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_SHIFT (0U)
5745#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_MASK)
5746#define ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_INTR_EN_TIE_SHIFT)
5747
5748/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT */
5749/*
5750 * ONFCNTOVF (RW)
5751 *
5752 * Overflow Bit for FIFO Overflow Counter
5753 * This bit is set every time the Overflow Frame Counter (Bits[27:17]) overflows,
5754 * that is, the Rx FIFO overflows with the overflow frame counter at maximum value.
5755 * In such a scenario, the overflow frame counter is reset to all-zeros and this bit indicates that the rollover happened.
5756 */
5757#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_MASK (0x10000000UL)
5758#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_SHIFT (28U)
5759#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_MASK)
5760#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_ONFCNTOVF_SHIFT)
5761
5762/*
5763 * OVFFRMCNT (RW)
5764 *
5765 * Overflow Frame Counter
5766 * This field indicates the number of frames missed by the application. This counter is incremented each time the MTL FIFO overflows. The counter is cleared when this register is read with mci_be_i[2] at 1’b1.
5767 */
5768#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_MASK (0xFFE0000UL)
5769#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_SHIFT (17U)
5770#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_MASK)
5771#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_OVFFRMCNT_SHIFT)
5772
5773/*
5774 * MISCNTOVF (RW)
5775 *
5776 * Overflow Bit for Missed Frame Counter
5777 * This bit is set every time Missed Frame Counter (Bits[15:0]) overflows,
5778 * that is, the DMA discards an incoming frame because of the Host Receive Buffer being unavailable with the missed frame counter at maximum value. In such a scenario,
5779 * the Missed frame counter is reset to all-zeros and this bit indicates that the rollover happened.
5780 */
5781#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_MASK (0x10000UL)
5782#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_SHIFT (16U)
5783#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_MASK)
5784#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISCNTOVF_SHIFT)
5785
5786/*
5787 * MISFRMCNT (RW)
5788 *
5789 * Missed Frame Counter
5790 * This field indicates the number of frames missed by the controller because of the Host Receive Buffer being unavailable.
5791 * This counter is incremented each time the DMA discards an incoming frame. The counter is cleared when this register is read with mci_be_i[0] at 1’b1.
5792 */
5793#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_MASK (0xFFFFU)
5794#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_SHIFT (0U)
5795#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_MASK)
5796#define ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_MISS_OVF_CNT_MISFRMCNT_SHIFT)
5797
5798/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG */
5799/*
5800 * RIWT (RW)
5801 *
5802 * RI Watchdog Timer Count
5803 * This bit indicates the number of system clock cycles multiplied by 256 for which the watchdog timer is set.
5804 * The watchdog timer gets triggered with the programmed value after the Rx DMA completes the transfer
5805 * of a frame for which the RI status bit is not set because of the setting in the corresponding descriptor RDES1[31].
5806 * When the watchdog timer runs out, the RI bit is set and the timer is stopped.
5807 * The watchdog timer is reset when the RI bit is set high because of automatic setting of RI as per RDES1[31] of any received frame.
5808 */
5809#define ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_MASK (0xFFU)
5810#define ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_SHIFT (0U)
5811#define ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_MASK)
5812#define ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_RX_INTR_WDOG_RIWT_SHIFT)
5813
5814/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_AXI_MODE */
5815/*
5816 * EN_LPI (RW)
5817 *
5818 * Enable Low Power Interface (LPI)
5819 * When set to 1, this bit enables the LPI mode supported by the GMAC-AXI configuration and accepts the LPI request from the AXI System Clock controller.
5820 * When set to 0, this bit disables the LPI mode and always denies the LPI request from the AXI System Clock controller.
5821 */
5822#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_MASK (0x80000000UL)
5823#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_SHIFT (31U)
5824#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_MASK)
5825#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_EN_LPI_SHIFT)
5826
5827/*
5828 * LPI_XIT_FRM (RW)
5829 *
5830 * Unlock on Magic Packet or Remote Wake-Up Frame
5831 * When set to 1, this bit enables the GMAC-AXI to come out of the LPI mode only when the magic packet or remote wake-up frame is received.
5832 * When set to 0, this bit enables the GMAC-AXI to come out of LPI mode when any frame is received.
5833 */
5834#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_MASK (0x40000000UL)
5835#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_SHIFT (30U)
5836#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_MASK)
5837#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_LPI_XIT_FRM_SHIFT)
5838
5839/*
5840 * WR_OSR_LMT (RW)
5841 *
5842 * AXI Maximum Write Outstanding Request Limit
5843 * This value limits the maximum outstanding request on the AXI write interface.
5844 * Maximum outstanding requests = WR_OSR_LMT+1 Note: - Bit 22 is reserved if AXI_GM_MAX_WR_REQUESTS = 4. - Bit 23 bit is reserved if AXI_GM_MAX_WR_REQUESTS != 16.
5845 */
5846#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_MASK (0xF00000UL)
5847#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_SHIFT (20U)
5848#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_MASK)
5849#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_WR_OSR_LMT_SHIFT)
5850
5851/*
5852 * RD_OSR_LMT (RW)
5853 *
5854 * AXI Maximum Read Outstanding Request Limit
5855 * This value limits the maximum outstanding request on the AXI read interface.
5856 * Maximum outstanding requests = RD_OSR_LMT+1 Note: - Bit 18 is reserved if AXI_GM_MAX_RD_REQUESTS = 4. - Bit 19 is reserved if AXI_GM_MAX_RD_REQUESTS != 16.
5857 */
5858#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_MASK (0xF0000UL)
5859#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_SHIFT (16U)
5860#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_MASK)
5861#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_RD_OSR_LMT_SHIFT)
5862
5863/*
5864 * ONEKBBE (RW)
5865 *
5866 * 1 KB Boundary Crossing Enable for the GMAC-AXI Master
5867 * When set, the GMAC-AXI master performs burst transfers that do not cross 1 KB boundary.
5868 * When reset, the GMAC-AXI master performs burst transfers that do not cross 4 KB boundary.
5869 */
5870#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_MASK (0x2000U)
5871#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_SHIFT (13U)
5872#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_MASK)
5873#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_ONEKBBE_SHIFT)
5874
5875/*
5876 * AXI_AAL (RW)
5877 *
5878 * Address-Aligned Beats
5879 * This bit is read-only bit and reflects the Bit 25 (AAL) of Register 0 (Bus Mode Register).
5880 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI performs address-aligned burst transfers on both read and write channels.
5881 */
5882#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_MASK (0x1000U)
5883#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_SHIFT (12U)
5884#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_MASK)
5885#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_AXI_AAL_SHIFT)
5886
5887/*
5888 * BLEN256 (RW)
5889 *
5890 * AXI Burst Length 256
5891 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 256 on the AXI master interface.
5892 * This bit is present only when the configuration parameter AXI_BL is set to 256. Otherwise, this bit is reserved and is read-only (RO).
5893 */
5894#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_MASK (0x80U)
5895#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_SHIFT (7U)
5896#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_MASK)
5897#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN256_SHIFT)
5898
5899/*
5900 * BLEN128 (RW)
5901 *
5902 * AXI Burst Length 128
5903 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 128 on the AXI master interface.
5904 * This bit is present only when the configuration parameter AXI_BL is set to 128 or more. Otherwise, this bit is reserved and is read-only (RO).
5905 */
5906#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_MASK (0x40U)
5907#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_SHIFT (6U)
5908#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_MASK)
5909#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN128_SHIFT)
5910
5911/*
5912 * BLEN64 (RW)
5913 *
5914 * AXI Burst Length 64
5915 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 64 on the AXI master interface.
5916 * This bit is present only when the configuration parameter AXI_BL is set to 64 or more. Otherwise, this bit is reserved and is read-only (RO).
5917 */
5918#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_MASK (0x20U)
5919#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_SHIFT (5U)
5920#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_MASK)
5921#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN64_SHIFT)
5922
5923/*
5924 * BLEN32 (RW)
5925 *
5926 * AXI Burst Length 32
5927 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 32 on the AXI master interface.
5928 * This bit is present only when the configuration parameter AXI_BL is set to 32 or more. Otherwise, this bit is reserved and is read-only (RO).
5929 */
5930#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_MASK (0x10U)
5931#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_SHIFT (4U)
5932#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_MASK)
5933#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN32_SHIFT)
5934
5935/*
5936 * BLEN16 (RW)
5937 *
5938 * AXI Burst Length 16
5939 * When this bit is set to 1 or UNDEF is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 16 on the AXI master interface.
5940 */
5941#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_MASK (0x8U)
5942#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_SHIFT (3U)
5943#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_MASK)
5944#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN16_SHIFT)
5945
5946/*
5947 * BLEN8 (RW)
5948 *
5949 * AXI Burst Length 8
5950 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 8 on the AXI master interface.
5951 * Setting this bit has no effect when UNDEF is set to 1.
5952 */
5953#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_MASK (0x4U)
5954#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_SHIFT (2U)
5955#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_MASK)
5956#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN8_SHIFT)
5957
5958/*
5959 * BLEN4 (RW)
5960 *
5961 * AXI Burst Length 4
5962 * When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to select a burst length of 4 on the AXI master interface.
5963 * Setting this bit has no effect when UNDEF is set to 1.
5964 */
5965#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_MASK (0x2U)
5966#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_SHIFT (1U)
5967#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_MASK)
5968#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_BLEN4_SHIFT)
5969
5970/*
5971 * UNDEF (RW)
5972 *
5973 * AXI Undefined Burst Length
5974 * This bit is read-only bit and indicates the complement (invert) value of Bit 16 (FB) in Register 0 (Bus Mode Register).
5975 * - When this bit is set to 1, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to perform any burst length equal to or below the maximum allowed burst length programmed in Bits[7:3].
5976 * - When this bit is set to 0, the GMAC-AXI is allowed to perform only fixed burst lengths as indicated by BLEN256, BLEN128, BLEN64, BLEN32, BLEN16, BLEN8, or BLEN4, or a burst length of 1.
5977 * If UNDEF is set and none of the BLEN bits is set, then GMAC-AXI is allowed to perform a burst length of 16.
5978 */
5979#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_MASK (0x1U)
5980#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_SHIFT (0U)
5981#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_MASK)
5982#define ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_AXI_MODE_UNDEF_SHIFT)
5983
5984/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_BUS_STATUS */
5985/*
5986 * AXIRDSTS (RW)
5987 *
5988 * AXI Master Read Channel Status
5989 * When high, it indicates that AXI master's read channel is active and transferring data.
5990 */
5991#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_MASK (0x2U)
5992#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_SHIFT (1U)
5993#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_MASK)
5994#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXIRDSTS_SHIFT)
5995
5996/*
5997 * AXWHSTS (RW)
5998 *
5999 * AXI Master Write Channel or AHB Master Status
6000 * When high, it indicates that AXI master's write channel is active and transferring data in the GMAC-AXI configuration. In the GMAC-AHB configuration,
6001 * it indicates that the AHB master interface FSMs are in the non-idle state.
6002 */
6003#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_MASK (0x1U)
6004#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_SHIFT (0U)
6005#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_MASK)
6006#define ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_BUS_STATUS_AXWHSTS_SHIFT)
6007
6008/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC */
6009/*
6010 * CURTDESAPTR (RW)
6011 *
6012 * Host Transmit Descriptor Address Pointer
6013 * Cleared on Reset. Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.
6014 */
6015#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_MASK (0xFFFFFFFFUL)
6016#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_SHIFT (0U)
6017#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_MASK)
6018#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_DESC_CURTDESAPTR_SHIFT)
6019
6020/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC */
6021/*
6022 * CURRDESAPTR (RW)
6023 *
6024 * Host Receive Descriptor Address Pointer
6025 * Cleared on Reset. Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.
6026 */
6027#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_MASK (0xFFFFFFFFUL)
6028#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_SHIFT (0U)
6029#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_MASK)
6030#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_DESC_CURRDESAPTR_SHIFT)
6031
6032/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF */
6033/*
6034 * CURTBUFAPTR (RW)
6035 *
6036 * Host Transmit Buffer Address Pointer
6037 * Cleared on Reset. Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.
6038 */
6039#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_MASK (0xFFFFFFFFUL)
6040#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_SHIFT (0U)
6041#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_MASK)
6042#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_TX_BUF_CURTBUFAPTR_SHIFT)
6043
6044/* Bitfield definition for register: DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF */
6045/*
6046 * CURRBUFAPTR (RW)
6047 *
6048 * Host Receive Buffer Address Pointer
6049 * Cleared on Reset. Pointer updated by the DMA during operation.
6050 */
6051#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_MASK (0xFFFFFFFFUL)
6052#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_SHIFT (0U)
6053#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_SHIFT) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_MASK)
6054#define ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_MASK) >> ENET_DMA_CURR_HOST_RX_BUF_CURRBUFAPTR_SHIFT)
6055
6056/* Bitfield definition for register: CTRL0 */
6057/*
6058 * ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL (RW)
6059 *
6060 */
6061#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_MASK (0x3F00U)
6062#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_SHIFT (8U)
6063#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_MASK)
6064#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_RXCLK_DLY_SEL_SHIFT)
6065
6066/*
6067 * ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL (RW)
6068 *
6069 */
6070#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_MASK (0x3FU)
6071#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_SHIFT (0U)
6072#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_MASK)
6073#define ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL0_ENET0_TXCLK_DLY_SEL_SHIFT)
6074
6075/* Bitfield definition for register: CTRL2 */
6076/*
6077 * ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN (RW)
6078 *
6079 * lowpower interrupt enable, for internal use only, user should use core registers for enable/disable interrupt
6080 */
6081#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_MASK (0x20000000UL)
6082#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_SHIFT (29U)
6083#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_MASK)
6084#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_LPI_IRQ_EN_SHIFT)
6085
6086/*
6087 * ENET0_REFCLK_OE (RW)
6088 *
6089 * set to enable output 50MHz clock to rmii phy.
6090 * User should set it if use soc internal clock as refclk
6091 */
6092#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_MASK (0x80000UL)
6093#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_SHIFT (19U)
6094#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_MASK)
6095#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_REFCLK_OE_SHIFT)
6096
6097/*
6098 * ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL (RW)
6099 *
6100 * PHY mode select
6101 * 000MII; 001RGMII; 100RMII;
6102 * should be set before config IOMUX, otherwise may cause glitch for RGMII
6103 */
6104#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_MASK (0xE000U)
6105#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_SHIFT (13U)
6106#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_MASK)
6107#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_PHY_INF_SEL_SHIFT)
6108
6109/*
6110 * ENET0_FLOWCTRL (RW)
6111 *
6112 * flow control request
6113 */
6114#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_MASK (0x1000U)
6115#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_SHIFT (12U)
6116#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_MASK)
6117#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_FLOWCTRL_SHIFT)
6118
6119/*
6120 * ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL (RW)
6121 *
6122 * RMII mode output clock pad select
6123 * set to use txck as RMII refclk;
6124 * clr to use rxck as RMII refclk; default 0(rxck)
6125 * refclk is always from pad, can use external clock from pad, or use internal clock output to pad then loopback.
6126 */
6127#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_MASK (0x400U)
6128#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_SHIFT (10U)
6129#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_SET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) << ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_SHIFT) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_MASK)
6130#define ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_GET(x) (((uint32_t)(x) & ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_MASK) >> ENET_CTRL2_ENET0_RMII_TXCLK_SEL_SHIFT)
6131
6132
6133
6134/* MAC_ADDR register group index macro definition */
6135#define ENET_MAC_ADDR_1 (0UL)
6136#define ENET_MAC_ADDR_2 (1UL)
6137#define ENET_MAC_ADDR_3 (2UL)
6138#define ENET_MAC_ADDR_4 (3UL)
6139
6140/* L3_L4_CFG register group index macro definition */
6141#define ENET_L3_L4_CFG_0 (0UL)
6142
6143/* PPS register group index macro definition */
6144#define ENET_PPS_1 (0UL)
6145#define ENET_PPS_2 (1UL)
6146#define ENET_PPS_3 (2UL)
6147
6148
6149#endif /* HPM_ENET_H */
